title: Oracle | Applications Engineer | Hyderabad
content:
**Education :** M.Tech in Computer Science (CSE) from a NIT (Mid-Level/Tier-2 NIT) 
**Years of Experience :** None/Fresher
**Prior Experience :** Interned for a year at a Semiconductor Company in the Final year
**Date of the Offer :** May '22 (On-Campus)
**Company :** Oracle
**Title/Level :** Applications Engineer (IC2)
**Location :** Hyderabad, India. (currently WFH)
**Salary :** ₹ 13,37,761 (Without Including PF & Graduity)
**PF & Graduity :** ₹ 1,01,195
**Relocation :** ₹ 3 Lakhs (Approx)
[Note : Relocation is not Lump Sum. It is handled via a third party & reimbursed against bills and is only for the Employee & his/her Spouse w/ children. NO Parents] 
Need to pay back = 100% of relocation if leaving before 9 months, 50% of relocation if leaving between 9-18 months
**Signing Bonus :** None
**Stock Bonus :** $ 15,000 worth of RSUs vested over 4 years (i.e, 25% annually after each year = $ 3750 = 3 Lakhs) [Will be around 200 RSUs in total across 4 years approx]
**Performance Bonus :** None (Not mentioned in the offer letter or communicated)
**Total Compensation (Salary + PF & Graduity + Stock)** : 13,37,761 + 1,01,195 + 3750*80 = ₹ 17,38,956
**Benefits :** Standard Benefits which includes Employee Medical Insurance w/ Dependets (Spouse & Children only), allowances, etc.

Also Note that Oracle has a slightly more pay range if you are from a IIT/Tier-1 NIT. Have seen other offers with Signing Bonus of 3 Lakhs/6 Lakhs and 600 RSUs over 4 years which is 3 times of this offer.

They tend to add/deduct some components of their salary structure depending on the college for On campus offers. 

Have also seen offers with no stocks and only salary (generally off campus offers or for people switching after a year). So if you are negotiating or getting an off campus offer without these components please do ask them to re-consider their offer. They tend to say that RSUs are not availabe for an Appications Developer/Engineer Role but they are generally low-balling.

Hope this helps.

    -  *Annual leave* of 15 working days in a financial year.
